current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To make enrollment in health benefits plans under the
		  Federal Employee Health Benefits Program available to employees of qualified
		  employers when fewer than 2 qualified health plans are offered through the
		  Small Business Health Options Program.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Healthy Competition for Small
			 Business Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended
			 by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 1311(d) of
			 the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:d

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
are available and no multi-State Qualified health plan is
				available, qualified employers in the State may make available to employees
				enrollment in a health benefits plan under the Federal Employees Health
				Benefits Program, in accordance with
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1302/ss:d/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
. Enrollment in such a
				health benefits plan shall be offered in the same manner that enrollment in
				other qualified health plans offered through the SHOP Exchange is
				offered.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:d/p:8/sp:B

text.#text:
In the case of a SHOP Exchange in a State through which
				fewer than 2 qualified health plans at each level of coverage described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, any Executive order, or any administrative regulation, and subject to
				this paragraph, a qualified employer in a State described in

shall be entitled to purchase coverage, rights, and benefits for the employees
				of the qualified employer under chapter 89 of such title if necessary employee
				deductions and agency contributions in payment for the coverage, rights, and
				benefits for the period of employment with the qualified employer are currently
				deposited in the Employees Health Benefits Fund established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:d/p:8/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be in a risk
				pool that is separate from the risk pool for individuals otherwise covered
				under a health benefits plan under the Federal Employees Health Benefits
				Program.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:d/p:8/sp:B/cl:i

text.#text:
Individuals covered under a health benefits plan under the
				Federal Employees Health Benefits Program under

2 or more
				qualified health plans at each level of coverage become available through the
				SHOP Exchange; or

1 or more
				multi-State qualified health plans become available through the SHOP
				Exchange.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:d/p:8/sp:A

text.#text:
The Federal Employees Health Benefits Program enrollment
				option made available through a SHOP Exchange, as described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, an employee of a
				qualified employer that is enrolled in a health benefits plan under the Federal
				Employees Health Benefits Program shall retain coverage under such health
				benefits plan until the end of the contract year.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:d/p:8/sp:C/cl:i

text.#text:
If the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program
				enrollment option is terminated, as described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:d/p:8/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, a SHOP Exchange shall be deemed to
				have 2 or more qualified health plans at each level of coverage only if such
				qualified health plans at each level of coverage described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:d/p:8/sp:C/cl:i/scl:I

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
are offered by more than 1
				issuer.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1302/ss:d/p:1

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1327 IS: Healthy Competition for Small Business Act
